org.logicmill.util.hash

Class SpookyHash

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.logicmill.util.hash.SpookyHash

  • public class SpookyHash
extends java.lang.Object
    A non-cryptographic, 128-bit hash function.

    SpookyHash is a Java implementation of Bob Jenkins' SpookyHash V2 algorithm (see http://burtleburtle.net/bob/hash/spooky.html). The SpookyHash class supports operations on data types byte[], long[], and CharSequence. All of the hash methods on this class compute the hash code for the provided data in a single operation, requiring all of the input data to be present in the src array parameter.See SpookyHashStream for an implementation of this algorithm that can digest input data in fragments.

    The hash engine state is initialized with a 128-bit seed (in the form of two long values) before each hash computation. Different seed values result in different mappings from key values to hash values. An instance of SpookyHash encapsulates a seed value, which is set at construction time and used by instance hash methods. Alternatively, static hash methods require the seed value as a parameter.

    This class is thread-safe and non-blocking; multiple threads may invoke instance methods concurrently on the same instance. Static hash methods generate no garbage. Instance hash methods generate minimal garbage; an array of type long[2] is allocated by each invocation to hold seed and result values.

    All credit for design and hashing acumen goes to Bob Jenkins. Errors and poor implementation judgment are the responsibility of the author.

    Author:
    David Curtis
    See Also:
    http://burtleburtle.net/bob/hash/spooky.html, SpookyHashStream

    • Method Detail

      • hash

        public static long hash(byte[] src,
        int start,
        int length,
        long[] seedResult)
        Computes the hash code for an array of bytes, using the specified seed value.
        Parameters:
        src - contains bytes for which the hash code is computed
        start - the index of the first element in src to include in the computation; must be non-negative and no larger than src.length
        length - the number of bytes to include in the computation; must be non-negative and no larger than src.length - start
        seedResult - on entry, the first two elements contain the seed value; on exit, the first two elements contain the computed result; length must be two or greater
        Returns:
        the first 64 bits of the computed hash code (the value of seedResult[0] on exit)
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the preconditions for offset, length or seedResult do not obtain
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length is negative

      • hash

        public static long hash(java.lang.CharSequence src,
        int start,
        int length,
        long[] seedResult)
        Computes the hash code for a character sequence, using the specified seed value.
        Parameters:
        src - contains characters for which the hash code is computed
        start - the index of the first element in src to include in the computation; must be non-negative and no larger than src.length()
        length - the number of characters to include in the computation; must be non-negative and no larger than src.length() - start
        seedResult - on entry, the first two elements contain the seed value; on exit, the first two elements contain the computed result; length must be two or greater
        Returns:
        the first 64 bits of the computed hash code (the value of seedResult[0] on exit)
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the preconditions for offset, length or seedResult do not obtain
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length is negative

        length - the number of long values to include in the computation; must be non-negative and no larger than src.length - start
        seedResult - on entry, the first two elements contain the seed value; on exit, the first two elements contain the computed result; length must be two or greater

      • hash

        public static long hash(byte[] src,
        long[] seedResult)
        Computes the hash code for a array of bytes, using the specified seed value. The computation includes all elements in src.
        Parameters:
        src - array of bytes for which the hash code is computed
        seedResult - on entry, the first two elements contain the seed value; on exit, the first two elements contain the computed result; length must be two or greater
        Returns:
        the first 64 bits of the computed hash code (the value of seedResult[0] on exit)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the length of seedResult is less than 2

      • hash

        public long[] hash(byte[] src,
          int start,
          int length)
        Computes the hash code for an array of bytes, using the seed value associated with this instance.
        Parameters:
        src - contains bytes for which the hash code is computed
        start - the index of the first element in src to include in the computation; must be non-negative and no larger than src.length
        length - the number of bytes to include in the computation; must be non-negative and no larger than src.length - start
        Returns:
        the resulting hash code, in array elements [0] and [1]
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the preconditions for length or offset do not obtain
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length is negative
